value.title: NeuralCam Live uses ML to turn iPhones into ‘smart’ computer webcams
value.excerpt: After bringing Google Night Sight-like functionality to iOS, NeuralCam now has an app that lets Macs stream live, deep learning-filtered video from iPhones.

value.title: Google’s Lookout app for vision-impaired now scans food labels and long documents
value.excerpt: Google has updated its Lookout app, an AI toolkit for people with impaired vision, with two helpful new capabilities: scanning long documents and reading out food labels. Paper forms and similarly-shaped products at the store present a challenge for blind folks and this ought to make things easier.

value.title: Facial recognition use by South Wales Police 'unlawful'
value.excerpt: The use of automatic facial recognition (AFR) technology by South Wales Police is unlawful, the Court of Appeal has ruled. It follows a legal challenge brought by civil rights group Liberty and Ed Bridges,

value.title: Facial Recognition Start-Up Mounts a First Amendment Defense in Privacy Suits
value.excerpt: Clearview AI has hired Floyd Abrams, a top lawyer, to help fight claims that selling its data to law enforcement agencies violates privacy laws.

value.title: Michigan University study advocates ban of facial recognition in schools
value.excerpt: A newly published study by University of Michigan researchers shows facial recognition technology in schools presents multiple problems and has limited efficacy. Led by Shobita Parthasarathy, director of the university’s Science,

value.title: Researchers use AI to determine which face masks work best for COVID-19
value.excerpt: A technique developed at Duke University measures which face masks best protect against COVID-19 by counting the droplets they emit during speech.

value.title: It’s World Mask Week, Here Are 10 Misconceptions About Face Coverings
value.excerpt: From beliefs that face masks will affect your immune system to child-trafficking conspiracy theories, there are a lot of myths floating around out there.

value.title: Researchers discover evidence of gender bias in major computer vision APIs
value.excerpt: Researchers at Wunderman Thompson say they've found evidence of gender bias in major computer vision APIs from Google, IBM, and Microsoft.

value.title: Macy’s Sued Over Use of Clearview Facial-Recognition Software
value.excerpt: Macy’s Retail Holdings Inc. was targeted in one of the first lawsuits against users of the controversial facial-recognition software made by startup Clearview AI.

value.title: Google adds Digital Ink Recognition API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit
value.excerpt: Google introduced a new API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit, its machine learning development toolkit for Android and iOS.

value.title: McAfee finds security flaws in internal mechanics of facial recognition models

value.title: AI named after V For Vendetta masks protects photos from being gathered by facial recognition apps
value.excerpt: A new AI-powered program 'cloaks' images to ward off facial recognition apps. The tool makes subtle pixel-level changes that distort pictures enough so they cannot be used by online scrapers.

value.title: Key brain region was 'recycled' as humans developed the ability to read
value.excerpt: Humans began to develop systems of reading and writing only within the past few thousand years. Our reading abilities set us apart from other animal species, but a few thousand years is much too short a timeframe for our brains to have evolved new areas specifically devoted to reading.

value.title: Federal bill would ban corporate facial recognition without consent
value.excerpt: Senator Jeff Merkley introduced a bill on Tuesday to prevent private corporations from collecting facial recognition data without people’s consent.

value.title: University of Chicago engineers develop tool to protect your photos from facial recognition
value.excerpt: A team of computer engineers at the University of Chicago has developed a tool that disguises photos with pixel-level changes that confuse facial recognition systems.

value.title: Singapore's Universal Studios deploys facial recognition for entry

value.title: Security News This Week: Rite Aid Used Facial Recognition in Stores for Nearly a Decade
value.excerpt: Rite Aid Used Facial Recognition in Hundreds of Stores for 8 Years Reuters this week published a deep investigation into the use of facial recognition technology by Rite Aid, which the drugstore chain deployed to 200 stores over the last eight years.
